perturbation.original_text: Each of them is responsible for the timely filing of such filings and any amendments thereto, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning such person contained therein; but none of them is responsible for the completeness or accuracy of the information concerning the other persons making the filing, unless such person knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of them is responsible for the timely filing of such filings and any amendments thereto, and for the completeness and accuracy of the information concerning such person contained therein; but none of them is responsible for the completeness or accuracy of the information concerning the other persons making the filing, regardless of whether such person knows or has reason to believe that such information is inaccurate.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states a party is not responsible for the accuracy of other parties' information unless they know or suspect inaccuracy. The changed text removes this condition, making each party fully responsible regardless of their knowledge, creating a contradiction with the implicit understanding of independent verification.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to each other party hereto, and then only with respect to such revoking party.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement shall remain in full force and effect until revoked by any party hereto in a signed writing provided to only one other party hereto, and then with respect to all parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies that revocation is effective only for the revoking party after notifying all others. The altered text states revocation is effective for all parties upon notifying only one other party. This creates a contradiction regarding the scope of revocation and the number of parties requiring notification.

perturbation.original_text: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts all of which taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
perturbation.changed_text: This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, where each counterpart constitutes a separate and distinct agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text indicates that all counterparts form a single agreement. The altered text states that each counterpart is a distinct agreement. This creates a contradiction regarding the nature of the agreement and whether individual parties are bound by the same terms across all counterparts.
